claimVictory(address,uint256,uint256,uin.details: To check if the state is victorious, we give the two last turns to ensure the state is legitime (signed by the two players)

params.boardHandlerAddress: the address of the Board Handler contract
params.inputState: the input state where we start checking the legitimacy of the victorious state
params.move: two arrays that contain the necessary information to perform the two last moves [index of the selected pawn, type of the move, x coordinate, y coordinate]
params.r: the two last r components of the signature
params.s: the two last s components of the signature
params.turnNumber: the number of the latest turn
params.v: the two last v components of the signature

params.boardHandlerAddress: the address of the Board Handler contract
the address of the Board Handler contract

returns.isPending: true if a timeout is pending
returns.r: the r component of the signature of the last turn
returns.s: the s component of the signature of the last turn
returns.timestamp: the timestamp when the timeout can be executed
returns.turnNumber: the number of the latest turn before the timeout
returns.v: the v component of the signature of the last turn

params.move: an array containing necessary information to perform the move [index of the selected pawn, type of the move, x coordinate, y coordinate]
params.nonce: triplet that uniquely identifies the turn (board id, game id, turn number)
params.r: the r component of the signature
params.s: the s component of the signature
params.v: the v component of the signature

params.boardHandlerAddress: the address of the Board Handler contract
params.move: an array containing necessary information to perform the move [index of the selected pawn, type of the move, x coordinate, y coordinate]
params.player: that player that simulates the move (0 or 1)

returns._0: the new state once the move has been performed, reverted if the move is not possible

params.boardHandlerAddress: the address of the Board Handler contract

params.turnNumber: the number of the latest turn
params.v: the two last v components of the signature

claimVictory(address,uint256,uint256,uin.notice: Allow a player to claim victory if the state of the game is victorious for the player, if it's the case, the finishGame of the board handler contract is called

getTimeoutInfo(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Get the information about timeout for a game

getTurnSignatureAddress(uint8[121],uint2.notice: Get from a turn signature (nonce, move, input state) the address of the signer, allow to verify if the player performing a move has correctly signed it

simulate(address,uint256,uint8,uint8[4],.notice: Simulate the state transition when performing a move on the game

startTimeout(address,uint256,uint256,uin.notice: Start a timeout, once started the opponent has to call the stop timeout function within 5 minutes

userdoc.notice: The contract for the logical flow of games, simulate turns, check turns legitimacy and claim victory
